channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024050119
item.description:
Report E-2024050119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL that was strapped down too tightly crushing the body and causing the lid to pop open. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release that impacted the plastic shrink wrap in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking PAIL, containerized the impacted shrink wrap, and cleaned-up the release with absorbent rags. In total, two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024050292
item.description:
Report X-2024050292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A HEAVY TOOLBOX FOR INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTENTS DUE TO THE LOADER SEEING SOME TYPE OF FLAMMABLE ITEM THROUGH THE TOP OF THE TOOLBOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH TWO MILWAUKEE DRILLS AMONG VARIOUS OTHER FLAMMABLE ITEMS. THERE IS (1) 4 OUNCE CONTAINER OF LIQUID TAPE (UN1133, ADHESIVES), (3) PAINT-RITER LIQUID PAINT MARKERS (UN1263, PAINT), (2) 1 OUNCE TUBES OF CROSS CHECK TORQUE SEAL (UN1263, PAINT), (1) 5.6 OUNCE CAN OF MAG TORCH BUTANE (UN2037, RECEPTACLES SMALL CONTAINING GAS) AND (1) LIGHTER (UN1057, LIGHTERS). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER TOOLBOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS DISCOVERED AND INSPECTED PRIOR TO ACTUALLY BEING LOADED ON A FLIGHT.

  • Description: DURING SIX-SIDED CHECK AN AIR PACKAGE WAS OPENED FOR INSPECTION DUE TO UNKNOWN MARKINGS BEING COVERED WITH SPRAY PAINT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DROPPED OFF AT THE UPS STORE #3065 IN CATHEDRAL CITY, CA AND SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RX3153, SELL YOUR CELL LLC, 74855 JONI DRIVE, SUITE 4, PALM DESERT CA 92260.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of material released from four (4) 1-gallon plastic jugs. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050055
item.description:
Report E-2024050055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: WALTERBORO
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding five torn 55lb bags of Caustic Soda Beads. The reason for the incident is improper loading as the bags were torn by the trailer wall. This resulted in an estimated release of 250lbs of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 15’x4’ area. A Contractor was called to overpack the damaged bags, cut-up the impacted tote, neutralize the trailer floor using a Vinegar Solution, and containerized the ripped shrink wrap. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. The remaining product was repalletized and will ship on to the Consignee. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: PPRX 663916 was found in the BNSF Railway Hogkins yard leaking from the top of the car when the car was moved. Upon inspection, it was determined that PPRX 663916 was leaking from the manway and released approximately 1 gallon of product. A BNSF contractor was dispatched, inspected the car and found the manway gasket deteriorated and one of 6 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. The contractor installed a new manway gasket, properly secured the car and BNSF released it to destination.

item.description:
Report E-2024050027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that seven (7) ounces of material was released due to a loose cap on one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the cap and used absorbent pads to clean the drum and then deployed granular absorbent and a neutralizer to the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The 55-gallon poly drum was then shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured in transit and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN12-impacted trailer and terminal yard. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums. The drums of waste and the damaged drum were staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • City: WALLER

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for further disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050053
item.description:
Report E-2024050053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1121 Hrs. on 4-21-2024, the WLE Rook Yard Conductor found tank car NATX 318056 leaking from the manway on top the car. He called the WLE Yardmaster who then contacted myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. I called Specialized Professional Services out of Washington, PA to go look at the car. They determined that the manway was indeed leaking. The found that the bolts were tight. They opened the lid and found that the seal looked new and that there was not any compression markings at the point of the manway safety bolts. They felt that the safety bolts did not have enough threads on them to tighten to the point that the gasket would compress. The installed a nozzle gasket, to replace the ring gasket, and then was able to get the lid to tighten fully. I had suggested to them that maybe the manway lid was improperly positioned on the nozzle causing the metal of the lid to hit the metal of the nozzle, thereby not letting the lid close tightly. They said they did not check for that and therefore could not confirm that idea. They closed the lid, tightened the bolts and installed new seal # 8418988 on the manway lid. They had also checked for leaks in the Roll Over Protection Housing but found none and then installed new seal 8418983 on that lid. The car was then released for service and after the car was moved, there was no leak noticed.

He walked off the plane unassisted and thanked the FAs ? Also of concern on this flight, passenger Calvin Lee George seated in 1A reported to the purser that his laptop was very hot and overheating ? FAs followed procedure and placed the laptop into the thermal containment bag and locked it in the aft Iav ? FAs reported this to the pilots and both MX and CS were at the plane to retrieve the bag ^ ? The laptop was not smoking or on fire, but very hot ? Laptop was returned to passenger after deplaning and MX brought a new thermal containment bag for the next departure CALVIN LEE GEORGE Email: Cgeorge1231@gmail.comEmail: Phone 307-258-4504

item.title: Report I-2024050007
item.description:
Report I-2024050007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: Seattle
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLDWIDE FLIGHT SERVICES INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: "11 packages were discovered in KSEA containing the following statement"Hazmat- Surface Transportation Only, Restricted E/ectronic Device." These 11 packages(see image below) did not include any of the DG markings or labels we train associates to detect(per ROC), but WFS nonetheless spotted and sidelined them. Had the packages not been sidelined, they would have been loaded onto ATI flight ATN3313(KSEA-PANC). The packages were non-AFN cargo, tendered and packaged by the shipper, Pitney Bowes. The sidelined packages in KSEA were opened to determine the exact content/product. All 11 of them contained Section Il lithium batteries in equipment, such as an ear cleaner, headsets, desk lamp, diving lamp. Of the 11, three were not labeled correctly: they contained rriultiple battery powered products, exceeding the two battery cell allowance for labeling exception. As a result, we consider these three packages to be undeclared DG, despite that they were not ultimately flown. Additionally, five of the 11 packages were packaged incorrectly: they were in a poly bag, not the corrugate box required by IATA PI 967/970. In terms of DOT reporting, per § 171.16"

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete dock and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Hepaco personnel stated that terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Additional granular absorbents were deployed by the contractor. The spent material was recovered and placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to pinhole puncture on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Clean Harbors personnel stated that Dayton Freight terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Clean Harbors personnel deployed additional absorbents and transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote to a new tote. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The empty poly tote and generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040178
item.description:
Report E-2024040178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/3/2024, at 16:54 hours, personnel in the CSXT Montgomery, AL Yard discovered TJRX 30025, a residue tank car that last contained Petroleum Distillates, NOS leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Gardner Asphalt, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 1395529). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and product leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV) with the valve in the closed position. MEI personnel actuated the valve between closed and open positions multiple times; once the valve was fully reclosed the release stopped. Upon further inspection, it was noted that the gasket in the bottom outlet valve cap was worn. Additionally, pieced of debris and corrosion were observed in the cap. It is suspected that corrosion and debris present in the valve seat were the cause for product flow through the valve in the closed position. Response personnel installed a new BOV cap gasket and secured the car for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Duane Thomas, 443-875-4818).

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and torn. Upon inspection 4 bottles were discovered of which 2 had no visible damage and the other 2 had some internal leakage. Out of the 2 that leaked out 1 had only about a cup left of solution in the bottle, the other one had only spilled about 2 cups and had majority of the solution. Both bottles had loose caps causing the spillage. The package failure was due to the bottles having loose caps and seals causing internal leakage during the unloading phase. I recommend for better closures for the plastic bottles.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1719 Pentrate Ultra Liquid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Kolor-Safe was then deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted pallet and absorbents were containerized into a second 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024040680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2in-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal dock and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a damaged 55-gallon poly drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and used absorbent pads to gather the spent material. The recovered absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was emptied into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and the damaged 55-gallon was over-packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

All waste was staged onsite for disposal.
